reasoning_trace.description: MANDATORY: You MUST describe what you see in the images (Charts, System Models) to prove you have analyzed them. If images are provided, list specific visual details.
Explain the System Mechanism and ISAC Coupling Mode found.
reasoning_trace.value: The system is a photonic-based THz ISAC system that uses a thin-film lithium niobate Mach-Zehnder modulator (TFLN-MZM) for full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of D-band LFM signals. The ISAC coupling mode is based on time-division multiplexing (TDM) of 16-QAM and LFM signals for communication and radar sensing functions, respectively.

reasoning_trace.description: Validate the physical consistency of reported metrics (Rate/Resolution).
reasoning_trace.value: The system achieves a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s at a center frequency of 134 GHz, with a calibrated mean ranging error of less than 3 mm. The reported metrics are physically consistent and align with the system's design and capabilities.

reasoning_trace.description: Identify the solved problems and remaining open challenges.
reasoning_trace.value: The system solves the problem of achieving high-range resolution and high-data-rate communication in a THz ISAC system. However, the system still faces challenges such as the impact of fiber length on system performance, the need for high-bandwidth devices, and the potential for false targets in multiple-target detection scenarios.

bibliographic.title: THz Integrated Sensing and Communication With Full-Photonic Direct LFM Reception and De-Chirping for D-Band Fiber-Wireless Network
bibliographic.authors: Boyu Dong, Zhongya Li, Sizhe Xing, Yinjun Liu, Junhao Zhao, Ouhan Huang, Junlian Jia, Jianyang Shi, Yingjun Zhou, Haipeng Wang, Nan Chi, Junwen Zhang
bibliographic.venue: IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques

application.scenario_description: The system is designed for 6G networks and can be used for various applications such as vehicular networks, smart manufacturing, and virtual reality.

key_contribution.key_contribution: The system uses a TFLN-MZM for full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of D-band LFM signals, achieving high-range resolution and high-data-rate communication.
key_contribution.gap_addressed: The system addresses the challenge of achieving high-range resolution and high-data-rate communication in a THz ISAC system.

quality_assessment.tqaf_notes: The system is well-designed and the experiments are well-conducted. However, the system still faces challenges such as the impact of fiber length on system performance.
